body:
Hey Tiger here,

Just wanting to start a discussion about the commands on Avicus. 
What would you add and what would you change?
Please comment down below

Please do not make joke or spam post thanks, Tiger

title: {Discussion}  Commands

replies.body: A party command where you can make parties that make it easier to play with friends
replies.body_tagged: A party command where you can make parties that make it easier to play with friends

replies.body:
A "/staff" command to see what staff is online in the current match you're in.

Similarly, perhaps a "/staff global" or "/staff all" to see how many staff are on all the servers and what server they're on.
replies.body_tagged:
A "/staff" command to see what staff is online in the current match you're in.

Similarly, perhaps a "/staff global" or "/staff all" to see how many staff are on all the servers and what server they're on.

replies.body:
/staff - Displays all online staff.
/infractions - Displays a users infractions.
replies.body_tagged:
/staff - Displays all online staff.
/infractions - Displays a users infractions.

replies.body:
Actually for staff let me give you pros and cons.
Pros: you can tell a staff if a guy is breaking some rules
Cons: if like hackers are on and they do /staff , they will know staff is on and they go onto a different server to hack.
it blows the cover of staff
replies.body_tagged:
Actually for staff let me give you pros and cons.
Pros: you can tell a staff if a guy is breaking some rules
Cons: if like hackers are on and they do /staff , they will know staff is on and they go onto a different server to hack.
it blows the cover of staff

replies.body:
From experience, I can tell you that most if not all hackers will hack anyway.

Also, most hackers that come on servers are normally one-timers, if they get banned it doesn't "matter" for them because they never went on regularly in the first place.

If a staff command was put in-place I think that it wouldn't change much in terms of hackers.
